note.p: Career: Attended classes at the Royal School of Mines, Kensington; worked at Cambridge; moved to London (1872); Professor of Geography, King's College, Queen's College and Bedford College, London (from 1876); Lecturer on Geology and Physiology, Dulwich College; Professor of Geology and Mineralogy, King's College, London (1896-1905)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1910-1911 vol 83 pp xv-xvii signed by A S W
